intro: Stenogyne kanehoana, commonly known as the Kona ironwood, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody structure. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of the Hawaiian Islands. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various native species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
